lines.content: **D++e** is a *homework project* created by ***a student***. It has the following advantage:
- Runs completely on CLI, friendly to users who type fast
The code is written in Java and you can edit it if you want. Here is a sample code:
With this code, `Task("hi")` creates a new task.
- [X] It still has room for improvement
- [ ] It has you involved as a member of project! :sweat_smile:
> To code, or not to code, that is the question --- me
[If you like my project, then click here!](https://github.com/nus-cs2103-AY2425S1/ip)
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* An abstract class that represents a command.
* DeleteCommand class is used to delete a task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the taskList to be deleted, starting from 1.
* @param taskList The task list that the task is to be deleted from.
+ task + " Now you have %d tasks in the list.",
* ExitCommand class is used to indicate that the user wants to exit the program.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
String message = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n";
* ListCommand class is used to list and print all tasks in given task list.
* @param taskList The task list to be listed.
* MarkCommand class is used to mark a task as done.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done, starting from 1.
* @param taskList The task list that the task is to be marked as done from.
System.out.println(Parser.addHorizontalLinesAndIndentation("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + taskList.get(index)));
* TaskCommand class is used to add a task to the task list.
* @param dialog The dialog from interface providing the task details.
* @param taskList The task list that the task is to be added to.
String message = "Got it. I've added this task: \n"
+ "Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* UnmarkCommand class is used to mark a task as undone.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as undone, starting from 1.
* @param taskList The task list that the task is to be marked as undone from.
System.out.println(Parser.addHorizontalLinesAndIndentation("Nice! I've marked this task as undone:\n" + taskList.get(index)));
* DukeException class is used to indicate exceptions in Duke.
* @param message The message to be displayed when the exception is thrown.
* FormatException class is used to indicate format exceptions in Duke,
* particularly when the format for input to Ui is not suitable for task creation.
* @param taskType The type of task that the format is not suitable for.
super(String.format("The format for &s is not suitable.", taskType));
* NoInputException class is used to indicate that no input is given to UI,
* Task class is used to represent a task in Duke.
* Abstract method toFileString is used to convert the task to string
* for storage in file with Storage class.
* @return The file string representation of the task.
* Static method fromFileString is used to convert a string from file
* @param s The file string representation of the task.
* @return The UI version of the task string.
throw new FormatException("Unknown task type: " + type);
* @param description The description of the task.
* Static method of is used to create a task from a string
* @param s User's instruction for task creation.
* @throws DukeException If the instruction is of wrong format.
public static Task of(String s) throws DukeException {
* Method getStatusIcon is used to get the status icon of the task.
* @return The status icon of the task. "X" for done task, and " " for undone task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Method setIsDone is used to set the status of the task.
* @param val The status of the task.
* Method isDone is used to get the status of the task completion.
* @return The status of the task completion.
public static class Todo extends Task {
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Method toFileString is used to convert the todo task to string
* for storage in file with Storage class.
* @return The file string representation of the todo task.
public static class Deadline extends Task {
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The deadline of the deadline task.
* Method toFileString is used to convert the deadline task to string
* for storage in file with Storage class.
* @return The file string representation of the deadline task.
public static class Event extends Task {
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from The start time of the event task.
* @param to The end time of the event task.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Method toFileString is used to convert the event task to string
* for storage in file with Storage class.
* @return The file string representation of the event task.
return String.format("E|%d|%s|%s|%s", isDone ? 1 : 0, description, from, to);
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be added to the task list.

* Method to mark a task as undone.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as undone.
* Method to get the size of the task list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Parser class is used to parse user input and execute commands.
* Static method to add horizontal lines and indentation to the dialog.
* @param dialog The dialog to be formatted.
* Method to parse user input returning executable commands.
* @return The command indicated by the user dialog.
* @throws FormatException If the format of the user input is not suitable.
* @throws NoInputException If no input is given.
public Command parseUserInput(String dialog, TaskList taskList) throws FormatException, NoInputException {

"Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"));

Task task = new Task.Deadline("Description for deadline", "tomorrow");

assertEquals(task, taskList.get(0), "Stored todo task can be obtained");
